review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2021
name: Ellie Andrews
title: The BEST vegan yogurt by a mile
review: The BEST non-dairy yogurt, hands-down! From the flavor (pleasantly tart just like regular yogurt) to the texture (pro tip, whisk it in a bowl or give it a vigorous stir in the jar before eating), this is without question and by a mile the best vegan yogurt out there. No weird gloopy texture, no plastic taste. Delicious and creamy. Pricey? Yes. But worth it for anyone who misses yogurt and can’t or chooses not to eat dairy. Buy it!!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
title: HEAVEN - and I dig getting an adorable jar to keep every time
review: Maybe the people who don't like this yogurt are used to sweeter, less probiotic-filled brands made of dairy?I'm not sure, because I absolutely love this stuff (it's not a pudding consistency, but maybe slightly closer to flan -- it's thick and firm).My favorite was probably the Bourbon Vanilla, then the Blueberry Lavender, and the plain is really good too.However, the absolute BEST yogurt I have ever had in my LIFE was the Culina I just got at Whole Foods in person.It's maybe a new flavor:Pink Grapefruit.I mean, I'm a big pink grapefruit fan, but my goodness, Culina's new grapefruit yogurt is one of the best things I have ever put in my mouth ever.If you have a discriminating, more natural palate and are off dairy (and you can afford it [I only have this sometimes as a treat ... it's even kinda like dessert]), THIS IS THE YOGURT TO TRY.Also, you get a great little jar to keep ;).Also, for what it's worth, I only take a few bites at a time then put it back.I make it last.It's that good, and eating a whole jar at once, though they're small, would be a bit much (full fat coconut).If it's helpful to know, I also like the plant-based Siggi's and the Harmless Harvest (plain esp., but NOT their vanilla) yogurts.So Delicious is okay but a bit too mainstream for me (ingredients, owners, etc.).Forager tasted weird, smoky and awful the times I tried it in the past.Lava is okay, but WAY weirder than Culina.The Culina is truly a sublime, gourmet experience.She also makes expensive little drinkable yogurts.Wow, those are something else, but again, very expensive, very small, so I only got them a couple times for fun.I drink them down in about two seconds flat, so it's a waste.If I were rich, I would have a fridge FULL of Culina.Maybe someday (I doubt I could ever craft something this amazing, no matter how good I am at goodies, so yeah, I'd have to buy it).

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021
name: Melo11
title: Good but too much sugar
review: This yogurt is delicious but it has so much sugar. In the future i would eat it as a dessert.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2021
name: Ashley
title: Must have
review: Best non dairy yogurt I ever had. Grapefruit flavor was amazing . Super think and creamy.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021
name: isabel D.
title: This stuff is good!
review: Great flavors and good texture, I get at least two servings out of it. Great alternative to dairy!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021
name: Aksana
title: Best Dairy Free Dessert
review: I am very picky about my desserts and dairy substitutes, but this one is SO good.It’s very thick, more like a pudding than a yogurt. It reminds me a lot of desserts I ate while growing up in Eastern Europe. My bf who does not believe non-dairy desserts can be as good as the “original” ones, loves it too! Just a note for people who prefer their yogurts to be sweet – Culina adds much less sugar than competitor brands. It’s a huge benefit for me, but I can see how some people may be disappointed.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021
name: Julio Rodriguez
title: good texture, not a fan of the flavor
review: This got put in my whole foods order as a substitution. The texture is pretty good, but I found the taste to be cloyingly sweet (or maybe acidic? It's hard to tell exactly what that cloying flavor is).

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2021
name: Amazon Customer
title: Horrible
review: The most disgusting item I’ve ever ate

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021
name: Leah
title: Fresh and thiccccc boy
review: This yogurt is the stuff my vegan dreams are made of. I love a thick yogurt. This is IT! This stuff is so delicious topped with granola! The bourbon vanilla is my fave. It’s become a mainstay in our refrigerator, replacing my evening sweet-tooth run for ice cream(thank goodness!). Highly recommended. A bit pricey yes, but this is some high-end, great ingredient, freshy fresh stuff. Give it a try!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021
name: Kindle Customer
title: Waste of money
review: Finally opened this the next day I got it and it had mold in it! Which is crazy. Not worth the crazy price.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021
name: Lind
title: Amazing yogurt, wish it wasnt so expensive!
review: This yogurt is thick, creamy and tangy. Amazing and unfortunately for my wallet, I'll be buying more.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2021
name: Bess
title: Thick but good
review: This but good. It is quite expensive for the amount.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2021
name: ec
title: Delicious
review: Incredible rich, decadent flavor….tastes like a dessert and better than any non-vegan yogurt I’ve had. The packaging is awesome…..I reuse the jars all the time because they’re plain and a nice size.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021
name: Rebecca
title: Vinegar flavor
review: The jar was cute, but it tasted like vinegar. Will not get again.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2021
name: Riderz644
title: Amazing flavors, clean ingredients, eco-friendly
review: Costs more than other non-dairy yogurts but is worth it. Why you should buy it: better texture than other non-dairy yogurts with terrific choices of flavor. The plain yogurt can be used as a base for making dipping sauces including for satays or other meals. Excellent on its own or in smoothies or as a base for desserts. It doesn't have cheap fillers, great for those who like to eat clean, especially with food allergies. Packaged in glass and paper and not plastic.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2021
name: Goddess
title: Yummy
review: The flavor and consistency is wonderful, however at this price point, I can’t see this being something to eat on any regular basis.

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021
name: Izewide Open
title: Superb!
review: Wow! Taste is sublime! Organic. Adorable, reusable glass jar. Love it!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021
name: Moutse
title: YUCK!
review: Absolutely horrible! I love plain yogurts and Whole Foods don't see the ones I used to buy! Neither the Oui ones!I thought that stuff was a regular yogurt and all I had was a weird taste AND a sensation of having flour on my tongue!This is not yogurt! You don't need to add a thickener like Agar in it!Will never buy that again. I'll make my own!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2021
name: Amazon Customer
title: If you are searching for a perfectly balanced non dairy yogurt Culina is the one.!
review: I love this product, it is the best non dairy yogurt I have ever tried.I have been in search of a Greek yogurt substitute because of my dairy allergies and I found it in "Culina".Most dairy yogurt substitutes fall short on flavor and texture or mouth feel. Culina comes through on both!

review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021
name: Nandi S.
title: Delicious
review: Best non dairy yogurts. I love all their flavors. This one reminds me of being on a tropical island. So tasty. Consistency is thicker than other brands but it doesn’t bother me and the taste is so worth it.
